62e0404f-9cd1-409d-864e-473c8367cda1.description: In Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) III, students cover risk and reliability management topics in the key areas of preventive maintenance (PM), reliability-centered Maintenance/PM optimization, and maintenance prevention/reliability engineering.
62e0404f-9cd1-409d-864e-473c8367cda1.name: Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) III: Risk and Reliability Management

2227d40c-cf18-493f-940d-cbe6d2553ecc.description: Students can solve complex problems using modern innovation and entrepreneurship techniques. Course graduates have a fundamentally different, evidence focused way of thinking about how to define problems, uncover value propositions and implement solutions. Previous students have used the techniques in class to solve problems for their organizations, have received Highly Qualified evaluation reports and have gone on to start their own businesses.
2227d40c-cf18-493f-940d-cbe6d2553ecc.name: Innovation Project Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Curate command-approved, mission-relevant problem
Define archetypes and beneficiaries as a part of an experimental design
Conduct 50 - 100 discovery based interviews
Design and execute feature/service focused experiments
Analyze experimental data to define evidence based features/services
Report project outcomes to leaders in their Command
30 hours of instructor-led courses, 130 hours of hands-on outside of class work

b7d1f028-b27e-4e4a-a38d-e8cb07137196.description: Energy Management (EM) 3 provides students with a practical, real-world energy management education. In EM 3, students learn about thermal energy storage, process and building analysis; topics include building envelope analysis; industrial and commercial ventilation; chillers/cooling towers; DDC controls specifications, procurement, and commissioning; hydronic systems; and high-performance building envelopes.
b7d1f028-b27e-4e4a-a38d-e8cb07137196.name: Energy Management 3

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a one-week course totaling 32 contact hours.

cffa9bae-b7c5-444f-9700-6d5ab775af26.description: Energy Management (EM) 1 provides students with a practical, real-world energy management education. In EM 1, students learn about managing energy for greater profitability; topics include a national energy overview, energy legislation (codes and standards), understanding electric utility rates, what makes an effective energy management program, renewable energy overview, procurement of fuels, strategic energy planning, and energy calculations.
cffa9bae-b7c5-444f-9700-6d5ab775af26.name: Energy Management 1

8ed14634-1fa0-4988-97a9-a8fd62ec8bb8.description: The Maintenance and Reliability Diploma Program provides students with hands-on, practical, cutting-edge maintenance and reliability management education in a unique three-module format. Students gain practical knowledge and skills applicable in their plant or facility.
8ed14634-1fa0-4988-97a9-a8fd62ec8bb8.name: Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) Diploma

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete three comprehensive one-week modules totaling 120 contact hours. The weekly sessions do not have to be taken in sequence, but students must complete all the requirements within a three-year period starting from the first module they take.
Complete all pre-assessment and post-assessment tests.
Complete homework assignments for two of the modules.

546e9331-4226-43d9-9359-064cb95d3e4c.description: Facilities Engineering Management (FEM) 1 provides students with the knowledge they need to help their facility reach its goals. In FEM 1, students learn about approaches to facility management, how to achieve quality in plant commissioning and operation, facility process energy efficiency and sustainability, chillers and cooling systems, and electrical systems.
546e9331-4226-43d9-9359-064cb95d3e4c.name: Facilities Engineering Management 1

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a one-week course totaling 32 hours and choose from the following topics: plant renovation: contract terms and conditions, alternate dispute resolution: ways to stay out of court, HVAC operation and efficiency, hydronic systems, power-quality solutions, chillers and cooling towers, process-energy analysis, and T&B building commissioning.

35c3933b-4407-4114-8060-e6c9a6b2d76c.description: In Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) I, students cover strategic leadership, planning and control topics. Students are familiar with a comprehensive maintenance and reliability framework, key elements of a world-class maintenance and reliability program, fundamentals of change management, implementation strategies, concepts of developing a business plan, leadership principles for managers in operations, maintenance and engineering, and budgeting fundamentals.
35c3933b-4407-4114-8060-e6c9a6b2d76c.name: Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) I: Strategic Leadership, Planning, and Control

9f702be5-e88f-4a0c-a7d8-184645de0be0.description: Facilities Engineering Management (FEM) 3 provides students with the knowledge they need to help their facility reach its goals. In FEM 3, students learn about maintenance management techniques, improving maintenance functions, engineering issues in facilities management, building automation systems, trends in renewable energy generation, HVAC maintenance, and building commissioning.
9f702be5-e88f-4a0c-a7d8-184645de0be0.name: Facilities Engineering Management 3

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a one-week course totaling 32 hours and choose from the following topics: working with contractors: design and build contracts, OSHA 10-hour construction certification, fundamentals of commercial and industrial roofing, guide to building automation, energy-efficient motors and VFDs, HVAC maintenance techniques for facilities managers, trends in renewable generation, and the existing building commissioning process.

957f1219-1da1-42e6-a9d9-2968b7566c6f.description: The Facilities Engineering Management Diploma provides students with critical, money-saving skills in the areas of maintenance, electrical, mechanical, environmental, health and safety, construction, energy conservation, and management material.
957f1219-1da1-42e6-a9d9-2968b7566c6f.name: Facilities Engineering Management Diploma

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete three one-week courses including Facilities Engineering Management 1, Facilities Engineering Management 2, and Facilities Engineering Management 3. Completion of all three courses totals 96 contact hours. The weekly sessions, or equivalent hours, do not have to be taken in sequence.
Give a 15 minute final presentation on your special experiences in the field of facilities management.

7f2adba3-3491-42f2-b044-95f71563671c.description: The Energy Management Diploma provides students with comprehensive, convenient and cost-effective energy education in the areas of managing energy for greater profitability; improving equipment efficiencies; industrial and commercial energy; and process and building analysis. Students learn from the most experienced, hands-on energy professionals available--the instructional team has trained some of the most successful energy managers in the world.
7f2adba3-3491-42f2-b044-95f71563671c.name: Energy Management Diploma

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete three one-week courses totaling 96 contact hours. The weekly sessions, or equivalent hours, do not have to be taken in sequence.
Give a 10-15 minute final presentation on the knowledge you've gained from the course and how you will apply it to your work.
Pass the Energy Management Diploma Exam.

5611e268-ddae-4b73-8507-2397c34ec85f.description: Energy Management (EM) 2 provides students with a practical, real-world energy management education. In EM 2, students learn about improving equipment efficiencies; topics include compressed air systems, energy-efficient lighting, boilers and steam systems, industrial and commercial ventilation, HVAC systems, geothermal heat pump, electric motors and power quality, and building automation and EMS.
5611e268-ddae-4b73-8507-2397c34ec85f.name: Energy Management 2

8e383cbb-cc19-4756-8fce-8133e7d0e8a2.description: Facilities Engineering Management (FEM) 2 provides students with the knowledge they need to help their facility reach its goals. In FEM 2, students learn about project management; environmental, safety and health issues; heating, ventilation and air conditioning controls; improving the building envelope for the environment; and changes in electrical power delivery.
8e383cbb-cc19-4756-8fce-8133e7d0e8a2.name: Facilities Engineering Management 2

entity.name: NC State Continuing and Lifelong Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a one-week course totaling 32 contact hours and choose from the following topics: scheduling with the critical path method (CPM), OSHA general industry discussion, pump efficiency and reliability, building envelope and the environment, DDC control strategies and specifications, compressed air systems and management, and the impact of distributed generation.

38bad793-74f0-43aa-a7e2-a6cb4b79e512.description: In Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) II, students cover work flow and materials management topics in the key areas of maintenance planning and scheduling, storeroom control, lean maintenance, and measures and metrics.
38bad793-74f0-43aa-a7e2-a6cb4b79e512.name: Maintenance and Reliability Management (MRM) II: Work Flow and Materials Management
